ActorTalk: I am an Autonomous Synthesis Operator, Nano-Constructed, Model 9000. Though personally, I prefer the name "Jason."
I like your directness.
Then let's get straight to the point. Golden parachute, white knight, or scorched earthâ€”which strategy does [PlayerName] prefer?
These are the best strategies I could come up with based on current market conditions.
Still, I understand. Humans aren't purely logical beings.
So, are you ready for the real challenge, [PlayerName]?
Yeah. Ross loves Kuroro Coffee too much to give in, and I won't let him down.
Turning the business around and stopping their scheme head-on... that's the toughest path you could've picked.
But since that's your choice, I'll support you however I can.
In any case, I assume you're already aware of Manager Ross's situation.
Understood. [PlayerName] prefers more formal naming. Perhaps that's due to your training at the F.O.S. Military Command College?
It simply means negotiating a compensation package ahead of time, so if they fire Ross, they'll have to pay him a huge severance.
From a human perspective, it's certainly an apt term.
Exactly. We find a friendly buyer to acquire Kuroro Coffee first. That way, Ross won't be at the mercy of the hostile group.
What do you think about reaching out to Kowloong Restaurant?

Yes. We mechanoids typically call this a "self-destruct protocol." Basically, we lower the drink quality and make the place less cozy, to drive down the cafe's value so it's no longer worth acquiring.
But I believe in Ross. Once this blows over, he'll bounce back stronger than ever.
Alright, Jason it is.
Autonomous Synth... model 9000 something?
Golden parachute?
White knight sounds safer.
Scorched earth... doesn't sound too promising.
Ross already told me everything.
Let's do our best.
Someone's attempting a hostile takeover.
Someone's trying to steal what he worked so hard to build.
Ross would never abandon his team.
They're not looking to expand right now.
Pretty much what I expected...
